p: Several studies have reported using liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) to measure the content of saponins in herbal medicines for better accuracy [ 20]. To quantify the contents of compounds 1 and 2 in S. hexaphylla, an accurate method was developed using a mass spectrometer equipped with an electrospray ionization (ESI) source. First, [M + NH 4] + ions were obtained in the MS 1 scanning mode ( m/ z range = 100â€“1500). Then, under the optimized HPLC-ESI-MS/MS conditions, compounds 1 and 2 were characterized by multiple reaction monitoring (MRM) through the transition from the parent ions at m/ z 1092.5 [M + NH 4] + and 930.5 [M + NH 4] + to the main product ions at m/z 773.3 [M-2Glc + Na] + and 347.3 [2Glc + Na] +, respectively ( Figure 2 and Figure 3). The contents of 1 and 2 of 0.0072 and 0.0016 mg/g, respectively, in the ethanol (EtOH) extract of S. hexaphylla leaves were calculated by single-point calibrations.
